text: Limnonectes longchuanensis is a species of fanged frogs in the family Dicroglossidae. It is endemic to Yunnan, China (in Husa 户撒, Longchuan County and Yingjiang County) and Myanmar (in Kachin State, Sagaing Division, and Chin State). It is part of the Limnonectes kuhlii complex. It is found in evergreen forests along hillside streams. ==References== * Suwannapoom, Yuan, Chen, Hou, Zhao, Wang, Nguyen, Murphy, Sullivan, McLeod & Che, 2016 : Taxonomic revision of the Chinese Limnonectes (Anura, Dicroglossidae) with the description of a new species from China and Myanmar. Zootaxa, , . Category:Amphibians of China Category:Amphibians of Myanmar Category:Limnonectes Category:Amphibians described in 2016
title: Limnonectes longchuanensis
